alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 8:31PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT AREAS BETWEEN CLINTS WELL AND MUNDS PARK THROUGH 915 PM MST... At 830 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Elks Group Campground to near Starlight Pines to near Clints Well to near Pine. Movement was northwest at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dairy Springs Campground, Indian Maiden Falls, Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area, Forked Pine Campground, Boot Lake, Stoneman Lake, West Sunset Mesa, Raymond Wildlife Area, Bar T Bar Ranch, Strawberry, Baker Butte Lookout, Schnebly Hill Overlook, Hanging Garden, Meteor Crater, Munds Park, Munds Mountain Wilderness, Wet Beaver Wilderness, and Lake View Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 297 and 327. State Route 260 between mile markers 239 and 251. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 300. State Route 89A between mile markers 377 and 378. State Route 87 between mile markers 262 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
